    • Method Detail

      • openConnection

        public Object openConnection()
        Description copied from interface: PoolableAdapter
        Open connection
        Specified by:
        openConnection in interface PoolableAdapter
        Overrides:
        openConnection in class RestServiceAdapter
        Returns:
        An object representing an open connection. It is typical to return the adapter activity instance itself, although any other object (but null) can be returned, which will be parsed in as a parameter to invoke() and closeConnection().

      • openConnection

        public Object openConnection(String endpointUri)
                      throws ConnectionException
        Returns an HttpConnection based on the configured endpoint, which includes the resource path. Override for HTTPS or other connection type.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException

      • getConnectionObjs

        protected List<Object> getConnectionObjs()
                                  throws ConnectionException,
                                         AdapterException
        Throws:
        ConnectionException
        AdapterException

      • getEndpointUris

        protected List<String> getEndpointUris()
                                throws AdapterException
        Returns the endpoint URLs for the RESTful service. Supports property specifiers via the syntax for #AdapterActivityBase.getAttributeValueSmart(String).
        Throws:
        ActivityException
        AdapterException

      • invoke

        public String invoke(Object conn,
                     String request,
                     int timeout,
                     Map<String,String> headers)
              throws ConnectionException,
                     AdapterException
        Invokes the RESTful service by submitting an HTTP requests against the configured endpoint URIs. Override getRequestData() to provide the requestData value (usually a String). TODO: use JSON instead of XML aggregate.
        Specified by:
        invoke in interface PoolableAdapter
        Overrides:
        invoke in class RestServiceAdapter
        timeout - time out in seconds. Ignored if no response is expected.
        headers - protocol request data, e.g. correlation ID
        Returns:
        response if the underlying protocol is synchronous or null otherwise
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - retriable exception
        AdapterException - non-retriable exception
        See Also:
        PoolableAdapter.invoke(java.lang.Object, java.lang.String, int, java.util.Map)
